result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chad A. Brown in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:45 a.m. Agreement stated - Ct 2 dismiss and read in, Def will plead to ct 1, $50 plus costs. Atty Kohn and Def agree. Plea quest reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed and read in on motion of State. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Kohn satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 possession of THC. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Nothing by Defendant. Court will follow agreement. $50 plus costs, apply bond, DNA sample. Pmt plan. Postconviction rights.

Attorney Cana G Kohn in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Authorization filed.  Complaint received.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court will receive not guilty pleas to both counts.  Bond will continue.  Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Chad A. Brown in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the court record.  Court questions def employment and residence.  Def can complete a new petition for court appointed atty.  Def can make an appt with DA.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court instruct def to complete new petition or hire an atty or represent him self  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
